TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit Help extends System.Object
public ref class Help abstract sealed
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Help extends System.Object

remarks.format:
## Remarks You cannot create a new instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help> class. To provide Help for an application, call the static <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelp%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelpIndex%2A> methods.
You can use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help> to show compiled Help files (.chm) or HTML files in the HTML Help format. Compiled Help files provide a table of contents, an index, search capability, and keyword links in pages. Shortcuts work only in compiled Help files.
You can generate HTML Help 1.x files by using HTML Help Workshop. For more information about HTML Help, see "HTML Help Workshop" and other HTML Help topics at [Microsoft HTML Help](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=178661).
## Examples The following code example displays a form that contains three buttons that can be used to interact with the Mspaint.chm Help file. The **Show Help Index** button displays the **Index** tab for the Help file. The **Show Help** button displays content in the Help file based on the value that is selected in the **Help Navigator** list. The **Show Keyword** button displays content in the Help file based on the keyword that is specified in the **Keyword** text box.
For example, to show the Ovals Help page by the index value, select the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.KeywordIndex?displayProperty=nameWithType> value in the **Help Navigator** drop-down list, type **ovals** in the **Parameter** text box, and then click the **Show Help** button. To show the "To paint with a brush" Help topic by the keyword, type **mspaint.chm::/paint_brush.htm** in the **Keyword** text box, and then click the **Show Keyword** button.
The example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelp%2A> method to display the different Help tabs and Help topics, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelpIndex%2A> method to display the Help index.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.Help#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Help/CPP/helpsnippet.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.Help#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Help/CS/helpsnippet.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.Help#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Help/VB/helpsnippet.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Displays the contents of a Help file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The `url` argument can be of the form *C:\path\sample.chm* or */folder/file.htm*. For information on the format of paths, see [File path formats on Windows systems](/dotnet/standard/io/file-path-formats).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelp%2A> method. To run this example, paste the following code into a form that contains a button named `Button1`.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The `url` argument can be of the form *C:\path\sample.chm* or */folder/file.htm*. For information on the format of paths, see [File path formats on Windows systems](/dotnet/standard/io/file-path-formats).
If `keyword` is `null`, the table of contents for the Help file will be displayed.
## Examples The following code example displays a form with three buttons that can be used to interact with the mspaint.chm Help file. The **Show Help Index** button displays the **Index** tab for the Help file. The **Show Help** button displays content in the Help file based on the value that is selected in the **Help Navigator** list. The **Show Keyword** button displays content in the Help file based on the keyword that is specified in the **Keyword** text box.
For example, to show the Ovals Help page by the index value, select the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.KeywordIndex?displayProperty=nameWithType> value in the **Help Navigator** drop-down list, type **ovals** in the **Parameter** text box, and then click the **Show Help** button. To show the "To paint with a brush" Help topic by the keyword, type **mspaint.chm::/paint_brush.htm** in the **Keyword** text box, and then click the **Show Keyword** button.
This example shows only the call to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelp%2A> method. See the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help> class overview for the complete code example.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The `url` argument can be of the form *C:\path\sample.chm* or */folder/file.htm*. For information on the format of paths, see [File path formats on Windows systems](/dotnet/standard/io/file-path-formats).
Compiled Help files provide table of contents, index, search, and keyword links in pages. You can use the following values for the `navigator` argument: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.TableOfContents?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.Find?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.Index?displayProperty=nameWithType>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.Topic?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelp%2A> method to open a Help file to its index page. To run this example, paste the following code into a form that contains a button named `Button2`.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.HelpExample#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.HelpExample/CPP/form1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.HelpExample#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.HelpExample/CS/form1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.HelpExample#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.HelpExample/VB/form1.vb#2)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The `url` argument can be of the form *C:\path\sample.chm* or */folder/file.htm*. For information on the format of paths, see [File path formats on Windows systems](/dotnet/standard/io/file-path-formats).
Compiled Help files provide table-of-contents, index, search, and keyword links in pages. You can use the `parameter` argument to provide additional refinement of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.Topic?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.TopicId?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.KeywordIndex?displayProperty=nameWithType>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.AssociateIndex?displayProperty=nameWithType> command. If the value specified in the `command` argument is <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.TableOfContents?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.Index?displayProperty=nameWithType>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.Find?displayProperty=nameWithType>, this value should be an empty string ("", or <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=nameWithType>). If the `command` argument references <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.Topic?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.TopicId?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.KeywordIndex?displayProperty=nameWithType>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.AssociateIndex?displayProperty=nameWithType>, this value should be a string that contains the topic name, or the keyword or numeric identifier of the topic to display.
## Examples The following code example displays a form with three buttons that can be used to interact with the mspaint.chm Help file. The **Show Help Index** button displays the **Index** tab for the Help file. The **Show Help** button displays content in the Help file based on the value that is selected in the **Help Navigator** list. The **Show Keyword** button displays content in the Help file based on the keyword that is specified in the **Keyword** text box.
For example, to show the Ovals Help page by the index value, select the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.KeywordIndex?displayProperty=nameWithType> value in the **Help Navigator** drop-down list, type **ovals** in the **Parameter** text box, and then click the **Show Help** button. To show the "To paint with a brush" Help topic by the keyword, type **mspaint.chm::/paint_brush.htm** in the **Keyword** text box, and then click the **Show Keyword** button.
This example shows only the call to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelp%2A> method. See the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help> class overview for the complete code example.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.Help#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Help/CPP/helpsnippet.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.Help#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Help/CS/helpsnippet.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.Help#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Help/VB/helpsnippet.vb#3)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `url` parameter can be of the form C:\path\sample.chm or /folder/file.htm.
## Examples The following code example displays a form with three buttons that can be used to interact with the mspaint.chm Help file. The **Show Help Index** button displays the **Index** tab for the Help file. The **Show Help** button displays content in the Help file based on the value that is selected in the **Help Navigator** list. The **Show Keyword** button displays content in the Help file based on the keyword that is specified in the **Keyword** text box.
For example, to show the Ovals Help page by the index value, select the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.KeywordIndex?displayProperty=nameWithType> value in the **Help Navigator** drop-down list, type **ovals** in the **Parameter** text box, and then click the **Show Help** button. To show the "To paint with a brush" Help topic by the keyword, type **mspaint.chm::/paint_brush.htm** in the **Keyword** text box, and then click the **Show Keyword** button.
This example shows only the call to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelpIndex%2A> method. See the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help> class overview for the complete code example.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyUp> event with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help> class to display pop-up style help to the user.
[!code-cpp[Control.KeyUp#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Control.KeyUp/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Control.KeyUp#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Control.KeyUp/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Control.KeyUp#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Control.KeyUp/VB/form1.vb#1)]
